info.name: Eskalator
info.attribution:
Library image is "Stairs, Movable, Shopping Mall" Released to the Public Domain under CC0. https://pixabay.com/photos/stairs-movable-shopping-mall-427963/

Game layout, scripting, expansion card text, and deck summary by dexdouglas, released to the Public Domain under CC0.
info.description: In Eskalator, you take turns playing cards of higher and higher values. If you can't, you get stuck taking all the cards (which is bad).
info.similarAwards: 2007 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
info.ruleText:
Click to sit at any seat and choose if you want to play the base game or the expansion. If you choose the expansion, each player will also be dealt a random player power that they'll have access to for the rest of the round/game that will allow them to break a basic rule of the game. 
In either case, you will be dealt 6 cards from the deck. On your turn, you must drag a card, or cards, from your hand to your holder, or pass. After playing, you should announce the value of the cards you just played. You can play 1, or more than 1, card at a time but if you play more than one card, the cards you play must all be the same value (all 3's or all 10s for example) . If you are playing, you must place a card (or cards) whose sum EXCEEDs the previously played card(s). After playing, click the "Draw & End Turn" button to draw back up to 6 cards and pass the turn to the next player.

If you can't, or don't want to, play any cards, you must click the "Collect" button and collect all of the cards that have been played this turn. Then you will start the next turn of the game by playing 1 or more cards.

The game ends when the deck runs out. At this time, everyone will continue to play cards from their hand but not replenishing. When one player runs out of cards in hand, the round is over. The cards that are in play are ignored but the cards in the other players hands are added to their score pile. Whoever has the lowest number of cards collected, is the winner. Ties are shared.

Special Cards:
There are 2 special cards in the game. The "=" card will allow you to pass, if played. The player who plays this card announces the same value as the person who played before them. NOTE: This card is absent in the "Expansion" game. 
The "1-7" card is a wild card that can be played alongside any other number card valued 1-7. 

Expansion cards: 
The expansion cards are dealt to each player during the expansion game. This allows the player to have some special powers throughout the game, or each round. Greater descriptions below:
"+3 to total value of cards played": When you play any card(s), whatever the value is, add 3. Example: a 2 becomes a 5, three 2s becomes 9. 
"Can play 3 cards of consecutive value": You can play a run of 3 cards instead of only multiples of the same card.
"Play any # of cards valued 1-5": You can play as many cards as you like as long as they are valued 1-5. 
"Start player. You can pass twice": If you are dealt this card, you are the start player for the round. Additionally, 2 times during this round, you can pass and not have to play a card. The value remains the same and the turn passes to the next player. 
"Your score is 1/2 rounded up each round": At the end of the round, if collected 13, you would only score 7 points (13/2=6.5 rounded up = 7).
"All your 7's are worth 14": Any 7, is now a 14. If you play a wild card as a 7, it is also a 14. Example: You play one 7 and a 1-7 together. The total value is 28 (14+14). 
"2x card values = 3x card values": If you play two cards of the same value, the total is as if you played 3 cards of the same value. Example: two 5's equal 15. 

Variant 1: Multiple rounds
If you would like a longer game, you can elect to play as many rounds as there are players. For this variant, use the black pawn to denote who the start player is for the round. Once the round is over and the card count is added to your score, hit the "Next Round" button and move the black pawn to the next player in order. They will be start player. 

Variant 2: Play from score pile
This variant adds a fair bit of planning to the game. Now, in addition to playing cards from your hand, you can also play cards from the top of your score pile. You can only play cards from the top to ADD to an already played card. You can arrange the cards in any order you like when you collect them so it is likely not the best practice to just hit "Collect" in this variant and insted just drag the cards one by one to your score pile in the order you prefer. Any Wild cards, or = cards are not allowed to be played from your score pile.
info.helpText:
Click to sit at any seat and choose if you want to play the base game or the expansion. If you choose the expansion, each player will also be dealt a random player power.

Drag cards to your holder to play and press "Draw & End Turn" to draw back up to 6 cards in hand, or press "Collect" to collect all cards and start the next turn. If you are playing 1 round, just check the # of cards you have collected and lowest score wins. If you are playing multiple rounds, add your score to the tracker and hit "Next Round" to shuffle and re-deal all cards. If you are playing multiple rounds and need to select the new start player, press the "Cycle turn" button and place the pawn next to the new start player.
